result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrelle Q Lock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript Sentencing Hearing on revocation Montrelle Lock 1/9/17

Case called at 10:57 am [sf]
Defendant Montrelle Q Lock in court,in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Hagemann provides factual corrections to the Revocation Packet information.

Court sentences Mr. Lock to 30 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 15 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 15 months.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 49 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Nicholas Burks
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--to pay outstanding court ordered obligations 
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--to pay outstanding restitution (joint and several with the Co-Actors)

Felony Firearm prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 11:19 am

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:42am [mo]
Defendant Montrelle Q Lock in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #2 as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered to the Amended Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Lock

On Amended Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Nicholas Burks
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--to pay restitution to Columbia in the amount of $5, 576.90 (joint and several with the Co-Actors)


Days credit for time already served:  35  days
recess10:54am
FINANCIAL NOTES: $500.00 bond payment paid via gps

Amended:
Court orders a combination bond of $500 CASH and $2000 Signature Bond, that Mr. Lock's mother, Linda Bowman is to co-sign.

Case called at 2:37pm 
Defendant Montrelle Q Lock in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered


On the Defense's Request to Modify Bond:
--ADA Shock opposes reducing the Cash Bond; basis given
--Bond Arguments given by Atty. Dahnert
--Questioning by the Court
--Mr. Lock makes a statement to the Court
The Court amends the bond to a combination of $500 CASH and $2000 Signature Bond, that Mr. Lock's mother, Linda Bowman is to co-sign, with the same non- monetary conditions.
recess:2:54pm

NEXT: (1)Pretrial Conference on 11/25/15 at 1:20pm (2)Status Conference on 12/17/15 at 9:45am

Case called at 8:39am [mo]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Montrelle Q Lock in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer Michael Zenoni -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--submits State's exh. #1(Wisconsin TIME system print out)--offered & received
--cross examination by Attorney Dahnert

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Lock committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

ADA Shock requests an Arraignment date
Atty. Dahnert gives arguments as to bond
--ADA Shock objects on the grounds of notice

The Court schedules this case for Arraignment and Bond Modification hearing. 

recess 9:02am

NEXT:  Arraignment/Bond Modification Hearing on 11/5/15 at 2:30pm
Request from the defendant for a bond hearing
Defendant appeared in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

Case called at 1:17 pm [sf]   [Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II]
Defendant Montrelle Q Lock in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews procedural posture of the case.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the Defendant asked his Attorney to adjourn the preliminary hearing, the defendant was put on a probation hold but that has now been dropped.
Attorney Svehlek advises the Court that the defendant has asked SPD for sucsesor counsel, which their office is now processing.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 CASH bond, with previous non-monetary conditions: 
-No contact with co-defendant Nicholas Burks, Samantha Zubke, Tiffany Steward or Maurese Gee
-No presence at or contact with the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
-Booking at JCSD

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

Recess: 1:24 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 10/30/15 at 8:30 am

Case called at 8:45 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Preliminary Hearing)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears on behalf of Defendant Montrelle Lock. Defendant Montrelle Q Lock not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he has no explanation for the Defendant's non-appearance, did expect him to appear today.
ADA Hall indicates that Mr. Lock has been traditionally late for his court appearances
Court indicates that It will wait another 10 minutes for Mr. Lock to appear, will release officer at that time.
Recess: 8:46 am Reconvene: 9:00 am 
Court orders issuance of bench warrant-Body Only
Court revokes and forfeits bond
Recess: 9:00 am
